info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:37PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Geauga, northeastern Cuyahoga, Lake and western Ashtabula Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 637 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chesterland, or 8 miles south of Willowick, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Painesville, Willowick, Chardon, Fairport Harbor, Geneva-On-The-Lake, Euclid, Mentor, Cleveland Heights, Solon, Willoughby, Eastlake, Warrensville Heights, Geneva, South Russell, Madison, Perry, Highland Hills, Timberlake and Lakeline. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern Ohio.
